p: In the study by Altintop et al. various thiazolyl hydrazone derivatives designed and synthesized. These derivatives evaluated for anticancer activity with targeting Akt on A549, C6 rat glioma, and NIH/3T3 cell lines. Compound 99 was the most potent and selective inhibitor than other derivatives against A549 and C6 cells with IC 50 = 12 ± 1.73 µM and 3.83 ± 0.76 µM, respectively and Akt inhibitory percentage of compound 99 on C6 Cell line was 71.66 ± 4.09% and on A549 Cell Line was 45.77 ± 10.58%. In addition, early and late apoptotic cell population (32.8%) were increased in C6 cell line by compound 99 more than cisplatin (28.8%) and notably inhibited the Akt enzyme. They studied the Akt active site and binding mode of compound 99 by performing molecular docking analysis. The phenyl ring of compound 99 formed π–π stacking interaction and a direct hydrophobic interaction with phenyl ring in the Tyr272 residue of the active site of Akt. Based on Lipinski’s rule of five, compound 99 was predicted as a potential orally bioavailable agent (Fig. 21) [ 112].
